channel.title: [Release] ShadowSting [Updated 3/2]
channel.description:
Erm, well, this is my first model, don't expect much from me till I learn more, but I made this in under 30 minutes with nothing but primitive models and that does mean that I traced nothing, which, not to brag, I believe is pretty good for having modeled for less than 2 hours with no tutorials. Also, all I have is the .mqo because I have no idea how to create a ready-to-use model and I figured I may as well release it like this, so pro modelers can make some epic edits on it, clean it up a bit, and use it if they want to. Okay, well here it is:
My Crappy Wires: [img]http://www.dreamocalypse.org/Modeling/FinishedWires.jpg[/img]
My Render View: [img]http://www.dreamocalypse.org/Modeling/FinishedRender.jpg[/img]
My Faces+Wires: [img]http://www.dreamocalypse.org/Modeling/FinishedBoth.jpg[/img]
My Regular Faces (Basically render, different view anyways though): [img]http://www.dreamocalypse.org/Modeling/FinishedFaces.jpg[/img]
I only used very basic prims for everything but the blade, which was a bit less basic, yet still very basic. Yes, I know, the poly count is OBVIOUSLY very high, but I was simply going for the best render, feel free to reduce them yourself if you want.
Thanks for checking out this thread, and I clearly do not expect much good feedback on this piece of fail, but please provide constructive criticism (keep it beginner-friendly please.) and download the .mqo from here:
[url=http://www.dreamocalypse.org/ShadowSting.mqo]Sword DL[/url] [url=http://pastebin.com/Ze7CL1AQ]Pastebin MQO[/url]
** All I ask of you if you use this on your server is [b]give me credits[/b]. You cannot legally claim this as your own, copyright violation is strictly enforced. This is property of MYSELF.

item.description:

item.title: [Release] ShadowSting [Updated 3/2]
item.dc:creator: @sjustin1996 sjustin1996
item.description:
@sjustin1996 wrote:

Cole1497:

Swords are the easiest things to do, and the most generic.

No. SPEARS are the easiest thing to do. I’ve made a spear in about 30 seconds and colored it in the same time. This took me a good 20 minutes to bring color to all around it (the handle parts were the hardest cause I had to get in on the ridges to color them).

Read full topic

item.title: [Release] ShadowSting [Updated 3/2]
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

I really love what you did with the gem at the bottom. Innovative really. Brilliant work as I’ve said before but that gem just topped the cake for me. Please… Do another. You’re going to be one good modeler. I do, however, recommend learning Blender but if you feel uncomfortable then go back to Meta because you are good enough for both.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Well if you want to improve, i suggest you think your ideas through alittle more. Make them alittle more exciting, draw the people in. If you want to go the next step of modeling try making a whole model out of acouple prims, with the knife, rope, move and scale tools. Goodluck!

Read full topic

@sjustin1996 wrote:

gravenfire23:

This is very nice much more appetizing than without color

I agree =P I think I chose an appropriate name for it as well, I hope to see it in-game in some servers too.

Hmm, now that I think about it, I got -rep just as I posted this. Whoever did that, you’re kind of a dick.

EDIT: 9 posts, 101 views? Come on guys. Give me feedback! What can I improve on?

item.title: [Release] ShadowSting [Updated 3/2]
item.dc:creator: @sjustin1996 sjustin1996
item.description:
@sjustin1996 wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:15, topic:384511”][quote author=sjustin1996 link=topic=480275.msg3516872#msg3516872 date=1299062339]

I have a 317 male model that you can have, ill pm the link to you soon. Also end result from what i see looks quite nice just the handle looks alittle too big.

Thanks, and the handle isn’t too big, it’s all as intended. The upper part is a grip, that’s why it makes the lower part look larger, but instead it’s just intended to be smaller and the handle should be very long. Should we all come to the conclusion that it is in fact a bad blade:handle ratio then I can easily modify that, and make the blade dramatically larger/smaller. I’m going for something with a large 2-handed looking handle, while not too long of a blade (I’m sure you’ve seen this quite a few times) that it sticks out so far that a tile overlaps it in-game.
[/quote]
Fair enough, is that world of warcraft you’ve got downloading aswell? lol :P[/quote]

Lol, yes, I had my 1.12.1 server online and was patching my 1.10.1 to 1.12.1 but aside from that, I am not about to search through hundreds of pages with the keywords “model (animating/animation) tutorial” so does anyone have a tutorial they used to animate theirs or something?

Read full topic

item.title: [Release] ShadowSting [Updated 3/2]
item.dc:creator: @sjustin1996 sjustin1996
item.description:
@sjustin1996 wrote:

Finished, screened, uploading the images to my site and then the new .mqo (I’ll throw it into an actual model when I figure out how =P

I have blender, I decide not too use it because it’s difficult for me to figure out (rarely are the buttons are self-explanatory, maybe 1 or 2.) so I may just open it there and see how I can edit it up a little with that, if I can at all xD

But here comes the new files and pictures!

EDIT: Didn’t bother to crop them this time lol, deal with it xD

EDIT2: Currently trying to turn this into a ready-to-use RS model, anyone got a tutorial link? I have no idea how to use dat maker really. Someone do it for me/tell me how? Thanks ^^

EDIT3: OH! Can someone provide a perfectly scaled character for me to use to scale/place the weapon on? Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: [Release] ShadowSting [Updated 3/2]
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“sjustin1996, post:8, topic:384511”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=480275.msg3516072#msg3516072 date=1299011446]
Alright, this model is good for your first one. Nice work getting straight into prims, just think your design through alittle more. To colour you press crtl + M and you’ll get a material panel come up. From there click New and a Mat1 will show up, double click on that and you’ll see a colour wheel and a bunch of other little things you can move to make the colour fade, look like glass, brighten up ect. So now on the colour wheel you just have to click someone where and you’ll get that colour. Hope it helped, gl with future modeling.

Oh and you have to open your command panel (on the left side) and look for mat, then just click over where you want the colour to be. You can also select a object (if your using prims its eaier) then go up into Selected up on the little bar up the top and go Set materials to faces (it’ll cover the whole selected object with that colour).
[/quote]

Thank you very much =D I’m glad I’m doing good so far. I’ll try to do better even next one! I may even spend a few days working on it to get it to be way better. I’m really trying to push myself as I start off so I can learn as much as possible and reach my limits as soon as possible to provide the best models to the community!

Thank you all for your feedback and support![/quote]

Can’t wait.

Read full topic

Thank you all for your feedback and support!

@amy_webb1 wrote:

Alright, this model is good for your first one. Nice work getting straight into prims, just think your design through alittle more. To colour you press crtl + M and you’ll get a material panel come up. From there click New and a Mat1 will show up, double click on that and you’ll see a colour wheel and a bunch of other little things you can move to make the colour fade, look like glass, brighten up ect. So now on the colour wheel you just have to click someone where and you’ll get that colour. Hope it helped, gl with future modeling.

Oh and you have to open your command panel (on the left side) and look for mat, then just click over where you want the colour to be. You can also select a object (if your using prims its eaier) then go up into Selected up on the little bar up the top and go Set materials to faces (it’ll cover the whole selected object with that colour).
